issue.title: Replace Sauce Labs with Playwright
issue.body:
It has served us well for a long time, but I've spent more (too much) time chasing issues that arise from changes to their platform, than to changes to the code we're testing. Mostly recently (https://github.com/Level/abstract-level/pull/42) tests started failing with the following error:

> Misconfigured -- You've exceeded your Sauce Labs concurrency limit. This test was throttled and ultimately timed out waiting for a free slot to run. You can upgrade your account for higher-concurrency at `https://saucelabs.com/pricing`.

Replacing Sauce Labs will reduce our coverage of browsers by only a small percentage (in terms of how many end users we serve by testing lesser-used browsers). The benefits far outweigh that: Playwright is faster, more stable, and we (in fact anyone) can run the same suite locally and in CI (without needing credentials). It's easy to achieve as we can continue using Airtap, but with `airtap-playwright` instead of `airtap-sauce`.

Side note: for the Airtap project, it likely means `airtap-sauce` won't be maintained anymore, at least not by me.

Repositories that this applies to:

- [ ] `abstract-level`
- [ ] `memory-level`
- [ ] `browser-level`
- [ ] `levelup` (remove browser tests altogether)
- [ ] ...

comment.body:
> What did I miss?

A spammer. Github must have cleaned up the post.

issue.title: `1.1.3` probably broken
issue.body:
### Describe the bug

I think there are issues is exporting the axios object and also a issue when in get function when in the instance of Axios class.


### To Reproduce

Install
- Axios `V1.1.3`
- Node `v18.4.0`


### Code snippet

```js
const { Axios, default: a } = require('axios');

const ax = new Axios();

a.get("https://www.eldorado.gg/buy-wow-gold/g/0-0-0").then(x => console.log(x.data))

ax.get("https://www.eldorado.gg/buy-wow-gold/g/0-0-0").then(x => console.log(x.data))
```


### Expected behavior

This code should have logged the data (html) from that url.
Mainly the issue is that default export is undefined.

### Axios Version

`>1.1.0`

### Adapter Version

_No response_

### Browser

_No response_

### Browser Version

_No response_

### Node.js Version

18.4.0

### OS

Windows 10

### Additional Library Versions

_No response_

### Additional context/Screenshots

```bash
There were bugs like
1. In default export, that is undefined. [Image](https://media.discordapp.net/attachments/723104565708324915/1031017046743461928/unknown.png)

2. `Axios`'s instance's get function have a bug as well. [Image](https://media.discordapp.net/attachments/723104565708324915/1031017137382363336/unknown.png)

I tested old versions and for me version `1.1.0` and earlier versions are working fine.
```

comment.body:
I can just give some background on how we're using `axios`. It's part of a custom module that we use in-house that's being used by _both_ node and the browser (react). The following seems to work well for both node and the browser:

```js
const AXIOS = require('axios')
const axios = AXIOS.default || AXIOS
axios.get(/* .. */)
```

Hope this helps.

issue.title: libnpmconfig deprecation warning
issue.body:
I get a deprecation warning for `libnpmconfig`:

`npm WARN deprecated libnpmconfig@1.2.1: This module is not used anymore. npm config is parsed by npm itself and by @npmcli/config`

```
$ npm ls libnpmconfig
└─┬ hallmark@4.1.0
  └─┬ unified-engine@9.1.1
    └─┬ load-plugin@4.0.1
      └── libnpmconfig@1.2.1
```

Not sure what the best way would be to get rid of it. Upgrade to `@npmcli/config`?

comment.body:
> Maybe we should merge #100 at the same time as it also depends on `unified-engine`.

Sounds good!

issue.title: Allow spawned daemon processes to remain running
issue.body: I'm slightly perplexed as to how this used to work, but testing either way shows that the daemon processes spawned by `hyp daemon start` have a tendency to terminate if they are launched without disconnecting their stdio from the parent process.

issue.title: Allow spawned daemon processes to remain running
issue.body: I'm slightly perplexed as to how this used to work, but testing either way shows that the daemon processes spawned by `hyp daemon start` have a tendency to terminate if they are launched without disconnecting their stdio from the parent process.

comment.body: @mafintosh Can we get this merged and publish a patch? I'm installing this globally with `npm i @hyperspace/cli -g` and manually editing this file to make it work. I realize you are working on more important things that will be coming out, but there are people relying on this to make it work on node 16.

comment.body: @dignifiedquire I'm learning rust now and curious about code duplication here. Since there are three identical pieces of calls to `iroh_util::increase_fd_limit()` with `match` and error checks. Would it be frowned upon to move this error check into `iroh_util::increase_fd_limit()` instead? (also the `use tracing::{debug, error}` can be moved).

Add a missing line generated by 'cargo new'

When running `cargo new hello_cargo` in the command line, one of the lines automatically generated in the Cargo.toml file of the `hello_cargo` project is a comment regarding more keys and their definitions. This comment is currently missing in the book chapter, and it probably should be added there.

_No response_

### Additional context/Screenshots

```bash
There were bugs like
1. In default export, that is undefined. [Image](https://media.discordapp.net/attachments/723104565708324915/1031017046743461928/unknown.png)

2. `Axios`'s instance's get function have a bug as well. [Image](https://media.discordapp.net/attachments/723104565708324915/1031017137382363336/unknown.png)

I tested old versions and for me version `1.1.0` and earlier versions are working fine.
```

comment.body:
I can just give some background on how we're using `axios`. It's part of a custom module that we use in-house that's being used by _both_ node and the browser (react). The following seems to work well for both node and the browser:

```js
const AXIOS = require('axios')
const axios = AXIOS.default || AXIOS
axios.get(/* .. */)
```

Hope this helps.

issue.title: `1.1.3` probably broken
issue.body:
### Describe the bug

I think there are issues is exporting the axios object and also a issue when in get function when in the instance of Axios class.


### To Reproduce

Install
- Axios `V1.1.3`
- Node `v18.4.0`


### Code snippet

```js
const { Axios, default: a } = require('axios');

const ax = new Axios();

a.get("https://www.eldorado.gg/buy-wow-gold/g/0-0-0").then(x => console.log(x.data))

ax.get("https://www.eldorado.gg/buy-wow-gold/g/0-0-0").then(x => console.log(x.data))
```


### Expected behavior

This code should have logged the data (html) from that url.
Mainly the issue is that default export is undefined.

### Axios Version

`>1.1.0`

### Adapter Version

_No response_

### Browser

_No response_

### Browser Version

_No response_

### Node.js Version

18.4.0

### OS

Windows 10

### Additional Library Versions

_No response_

### Additional context/Screenshots

```bash
There were bugs like
1. In default export, that is undefined. [Image](https://media.discordapp.net/attachments/723104565708324915/1031017046743461928/unknown.png)

2. `Axios`'s instance's get function have a bug as well. [Image](https://media.discordapp.net/attachments/723104565708324915/1031017137382363336/unknown.png)

I tested old versions and for me version `1.1.0` and earlier versions are working fine.
```

issue.title: libnpmconfig deprecation warning
issue.body:
I get a deprecation warning for `libnpmconfig`:

`npm WARN deprecated libnpmconfig@1.2.1: This module is not used anymore. npm config is parsed by npm itself and by @npmcli/config`

```
$ npm ls libnpmconfig
└─┬ hallmark@4.1.0
  └─┬ unified-engine@9.1.1
    └─┬ load-plugin@4.0.1
      └── libnpmconfig@1.2.1
```

Not sure what the best way would be to get rid of it. Upgrade to `@npmcli/config`?

comment.body:
> Maybe we should merge #100 at the same time as it also depends on `unified-engine`.

Sounds good!

issue.title: Replace Sauce Labs with Playwright
issue.body:
It has served us well for a long time, but I've spent more (too much) time chasing issues that arise from changes to their platform, than to changes to the code we're testing. Mostly recently (https://github.com/Level/abstract-level/pull/42) tests started failing with the following error:

> Misconfigured -- You've exceeded your Sauce Labs concurrency limit. This test was throttled and ultimately timed out waiting for a free slot to run. You can upgrade your account for higher-concurrency at `https://saucelabs.com/pricing`.

Replacing Sauce Labs will reduce our coverage of browsers by only a small percentage (in terms of how many end users we serve by testing lesser-used browsers). The benefits far outweigh that: Playwright is faster, more stable, and we (in fact anyone) can run the same suite locally and in CI (without needing credentials). It's easy to achieve as we can continue using Airtap, but with `airtap-playwright` instead of `airtap-sauce`.

Side note: for the Airtap project, it likely means `airtap-sauce` won't be maintained anymore, at least not by me.

Repositories that this applies to:

- [ ] `abstract-level`
- [ ] `memory-level`
- [ ] `browser-level`
- [ ] `levelup` (remove browser tests altogether)
- [ ] ...

comment.body:
> What did I miss?

A spammer. Github must have cleaned up the post.

It's easy to achieve as we can continue using Airtap, but with `airtap-playwright` instead of `airtap-sauce`.

Side note: for the Airtap project, it likely means `airtap-sauce` won't be maintained anymore, at least not by me.

Repositories that this applies to:

- [ ] `browser-level`
- [ ] `levelup` (remove browser tests altogether)
- [ ] ...

issue.title: `1.1.3` probably broken
issue.body:
### Describe the bug

I think there are issues is exporting the axios object and also a issue when in get function when in the instance of Axios class.


### To Reproduce

Install
- Axios `V1.1.3`
- Node `v18.4.0`


### Code snippet

```js
const { Axios, default: a } = require('axios');

const ax = new Axios();

a.get("https://www.eldorado.gg/buy-wow-gold/g/0-0-0").then(x => console.log(x.data))

ax.get("https://www.eldorado.gg/buy-wow-gold/g/0-0-0").then(x => console.log(x.data))
```


### Expected behavior

This code should have logged the data (html) from that url.
Mainly the issue is that default export is undefined.

### Axios Version

`>1.1.0`

### Adapter Version

_No response_

### Browser

_No response_

### Browser Version

_No response_

### Node.js Version

18.4.0

### OS

Windows 10

### Additional Library Versions

_No response_

### Additional context/Screenshots

```bash
There were bugs like
1. In default export, that is undefined. [Image](https://media.discordapp.net/attachments/723104565708324915/1031017046743461928/unknown.png)

2. `Axios`'s instance's get function have a bug as well. [Image](https://media.discordapp.net/attachments/723104565708324915/1031017137382363336/unknown.png)

I tested old versions and for me version `1.1.0` and earlier versions are working fine.
```

comment.body:
I can just give some background on how we're using `axios`. It's part of a custom module that we use in-house that's being used by _both_ node and the browser (react). The following seems to work well for both node and the browser:

```js
const AXIOS = require('axios')
const axios = AXIOS.default || AXIOS
axios.get(/* .. */)
```

Hope this helps.

This looks really clean. I take it `async function*` is the pattern for returning back an async iterator. Yeah, sorry, I have hardly used them before.

issue.title: libnpmconfig deprecation warning
issue.body:
I get a deprecation warning for `libnpmconfig`:

`npm WARN deprecated libnpmconfig@1.2.1: This module is not used anymore. npm config is parsed by npm itself and by @npmcli/config`

```
$ npm ls libnpmconfig
└─┬ hallmark@4.1.0
  └─┬ unified-engine@9.1.1
    └─┬ load-plugin@4.0.1
      └── libnpmconfig@1.2.1
```

Not sure what the best way would be to get rid of it. Upgrade to `@npmcli/config`?

comment.body:
> Maybe we should merge #100 at the same time as it also depends on `unified-engine`.

Sounds good!

issue.title: Allow spawned daemon processes to remain running
issue.body: I'm slightly perplexed as to how this used to work, but testing either way shows that the daemon processes spawned by `hyp daemon start` have a tendency to terminate if they are launched without disconnecting their stdio from the parent process.

issue.title: Allow spawned daemon processes to remain running
issue.body: I'm slightly perplexed as to how this used to work, but testing either way shows that the daemon processes spawned by `hyp daemon start` have a tendency to terminate if they are launched without disconnecting their stdio from the parent process.

comment.body: @mafintosh Can we get this merged and publish a patch? I'm installing this globally with `npm i @hyperspace/cli -g` and manually editing this file to make it work. I realize you are working on more important things that will be coming out, but there are people relying on this to make it work on node 16.

commits.message: A function with a mutable reference can mutate, but does not have to

Add a missing line generated by 'cargo new'

When running `cargo new hello_cargo` in the command line, one of the lines automatically generated in the Cargo.toml file of the `hello_cargo` project is a comment regarding more keys and their definitions. This comment is currently missing in the book chapter, and it probably should be added there.
